intro: Columnea pendula, commonly known as the hanging columnea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its pendulous, tubular flowers that often display vibrant colors such as red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, clinging to trees in its natural habitat, and produces small, opposite leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular among gardeners for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
